Interface amm.http.HTTPClient 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Interface amm.http.HTTPClient

public interface HTTPClient
extends Object
This interface defines the methods required by a HTTPConnect to connect to an HTTP server and retrieve content. The HTTPConnect calls the response method of the HTTPClient to handle the actual content. The HTTPClient can feel free to ignore the content if it cannot handle the appropriate MIME type.
See Also:
HTTPConnect

GET
The appropriate String for a request using the GET method.
HEAD
The appropriate String for a request using the HEAD method.
MIME_FORM
The appropriate MIME type for an HTTP encoded Form.
POST
The appropriate String for a request using the POST method.

abs_path()
Returns the path of the file to retrieve from the HTTP server.
content()
Returns the content for POST requests.
contentLength()
Returns the content length for POST requests.
contentType()
Returns the MIME content type for POST requests.
host()
Returns the host name (and port, if required) for the HTTPConnect to connect to (ie "www.nowhere.com:4039").
method()
Returns the request method - typically GET, POST, or HEAD.
response(String, long, DataInputStream)
The HTTPConnect passes the content type and length and an Input Stream with the content itself using this method.
returnCode(int, String)
The HTTPConnect passes the server's response code and description using this method.
status(String)
The HTTPConnect uses this method to pass any status information to the HTTPClient.

GET 
  public final static String GET
The appropriate String for a request using the GET method.
HEAD 
  public final static String HEAD
The appropriate String for a request using the HEAD method.
POST 
  public final static String POST
The appropriate String for a request using the POST method.
MIME_FORM 
  public final static String MIME_FORM
The appropriate MIME type for an HTTP encoded Form.

host 
  public abstract String host()
Returns the host name (and port, if required) for the HTTPConnect to connect to (ie "www.nowhere.com:4039"). The default port is 80.
Returns:
The host to connect to.
abs_path 
  public abstract String abs_path()
Returns the path of the file to retrieve from the HTTP server. The path should be relative to the root of the server, and start with a / (even an empty path).
Returns:
The path of the file to retrieve.
method 
  public abstract String method()
Returns the request method - typically GET, POST, or HEAD.
Returns:
The request method.
contentType 
  public abstract String contentType()
Returns the MIME content type for POST requests.
Returns:
The content type.
contentLength 
  public abstract long contentLength()
Returns the content length for POST requests.
Returns:
The content length.
content 
  public abstract String content()
Returns the content for POST requests.
Returns:
The content.
returnCode 
  public abstract void returnCode(int code,
                                  String desc)
The HTTPConnect passes the server's response code and description using this method. A code in the 200s indicates a successful request, and a call to response() should be forthcoming. A code in the 300s to 500s indicates some error preventing further data transfer. In this case, response() will not be called.
Parameters:
code - The status code of the server's response.
desc - The status description of the server's response.
See Also:
response
response 
  public abstract void response(String cType,
                                long cLength,
                                DataInputStream in)
The HTTPConnect passes the content type and length and an Input Stream with the content itself using this method. The HTTPClient can decide how (and whether) to handle the content. The default length or type are used if the HTTP server did not specify one of the fields.
Parameters:
cType - The content type (defaults to "unknown").
cLength - The content length (defaults to -1).
in - A stream holding the content (no header information).
status 
  public abstract void status(String line)
The HTTPConnect uses this method to pass any status information to the HTTPClient.
Parameters:
line - The status string.
